thread.title: These will be the toughest jobs to fill in 2016
thread.title_full: These will be the toughest jobs to fill in 2016 - seattlepi.com

author: seattlepi.com
title: These will be the toughest jobs to fill in 2016
text:
Baby boomers will play a big role in the job market of the future.
A new report by job site CareerCast looks at the most difficult occupations to fill in 2016. Two key factors: the jobs that the aging U.S. population will be leaving and the services that that those potential retirees will need.
RELATED: The best jobs without a 4-year degree
The latter would include nurses and physical therapists as 38 percent of the working-age population is expected to retire in the next 10 years. Other positions that will be looking for skilled employees in the near future are in emerging fields (ex. data scientist) and tech positions (ex. software engineer).
CareerCast looked at Bureau of Labor Statistics data on estimated job growth and where prospective hires are lacking to compile the list. For example, in regards to nurses, the BLS projects a 19 percent growth rate by 2022." However, "it also estimates that 525,000 currently working registered nurses will have to be replaced due to retirements, which puts the total number of new hires anticipated at 1.05 million over the next seven years.‚Äù
See the gallery above for the 10 jobs that will be toughest to fill in 2016.
h/t Society for Human Resource Management
